data.title: A step back in time - nothing else like it in Southern California
data.text: I live about a mile from the Circle (oh yeah it's called the Plaza... a "townie" joke), and grew up in Orange. "That Thing You Do" (a 90s Tom Hanks film) was shot here and it really looks like something out of the 50s. This was a regular shopping area in the 60s, complete with a JC Penny and various merchants that supplied shoes, lock servicing, camera supplies, a couple drug stores, etc. All of those shops are long gone, except for Watson's Drugstore, recently converted to a fountain and cafe, and the Army-Navy Store, which has been in business since the mid-50s. The other shops were replaced with antique malls, and now some of those have been replaced with restaurants and specialty shops. I still love to visit the park at the center of the traffic circle and have been so happy to see that others feel the same. In fact I go out of my way to travel through it regularly when I out for a run. It's a nice place to take out of town visitors to just browse the shops and have something delicious to eat.

data.title: A must for those looking for antiques
data.text: We live not far from here and walk into town at least once a month. We love just walking around the plaza and checking out the antique stores. There are also some great restaurants in the plaza.

data.title: Center of the City
data.text: This was included on our Old Towne Orange Walking Tour.  The history was interesting.  It was developed by Mr. Chapman and Mr. Glassell to clean up the center of town and have a place for the townspeople to gather.

data.title: Looks like it did in 1955
data.text: Fun place to walk and scope out restaurants and antique stores. Great way to spend an afternoon. So much to see and enjoy, definitely worth a visit.

data.title: Every Love Affair Has Its Heart
data.text: Whether you call it "the Circle" (BZZZ, try again) or "the Plaza" (Ding! Ding! Ding!) this is, without a doubt, the centerpiece jewel of Old Towne Orange. It's a place to meet, a place to shop, and always a beautiful place to relax and watch the world go 'round. (If you find an available bench then the world will be - quite literally - circling around you. Grab a coffee at nearby Cafe Lucca, or a made to order pizza from Blaze or Pizza Press, and you've got an instant picnic at this out-in-the-open hideaway.

data.title: The Center of Orange
data.text: In the middle of the plaza, surrounded by the traffic circle, is the Plaza Square Park.  It's a great place to sit and take in the whole Old Town area.

data.title: A quaint Plaza with friendly people
data.text: My hubbie & I like to go to dinner somewhere around the Square & walk to the Plaza in the center of the circle at Chapman & Glassell. The Veterans hold a meeting Wed. early eve. All are welcome. They retire the flag that most Americans LOVE & RESPECT!!  The Plaza is decorated for all holidays.  There are benches, grass, trees & a fountain. We stay away Memorial Day weekend.  Orange has their International Street Faire & too many people & way too much alcohol for my likings.

data.title: 面白いものがたくさんありました
data.text: Army Navy Store を目的に訪れましたが、その周りの多くのアンティークショップを長い時間見て回りました。旅行中だったため大きさで諦めた商品もありました。スーツケースに入るサイズのものをいろいろ買いました。とても楽しい時間を過ごせました。
